@angel_0f_deathx I‚Äôve asked people to explain why, if one is good at it, why sex work is any different than me working as a freelance artist. I‚Äôm selling my ability the same way. No one has ever given me a satisfactory answer. The excuse is almost always dripping with latent Puritanism.
@RavenWritinDesk Keith Giffen‚Äôs Justice League of the late 80‚Äôs/early 90‚Äôs was brilliant.

@StokesTheWriter @austinahamblin Oh, I agree that it‚Äôs on the creator(s). I‚Äôm just saying that everything can be done right - well written, good/great art, marketing reaches a wide audience and does a good job of conveying the product. But none of those is a guarantee of interest.

@StokesTheWriter @austinahamblin I would argue that you could have something well written, beautifully drawn and even well marketed to a potential audience, but it could still fall on its face because it‚Äôs a story that lacks interest. It happens at times.

@BeatTheCult Just about. Was an altar boy growing up. Read most of it. No priest was able to provide adequate answers to my questions. Was a Full blown Atheist by my sophomore year of high school.
@notcapnamerica Talking US version. Never really saw the UK version.
@notcapnamerica I‚Äôve tried to watch it several times. Just never could get into it. I‚Äôve seen bits I like, but whole episodes have been a struggle.

@AmbientSynthy Nothing is wrong with either. It‚Äôs been over 30 years since I left the church. I suspect my existential dread was greater then, but I don‚Äôt recall having issues with it then, either. In fairness, my wife and kids are pretty sure I‚Äôm neurodivergent, so that could be a factor.

@AmbientSynthy I don‚Äôt buy into the idea that we end up in some wierd, idyllic, post-life fairy land. However, I do believe our legacy is the stories we leave behind. Some of us fade in a couple generations, others? There are stories told for centuries (see people like Bach, DaVinci, etc).

@PrairiePhlox And my kid just reminded me - Beats, Rhymes & Life: A Tribe Called Quest is really well done, and Lightning in A Bottle is a great combination concert/history of the Blues.
@PrairiePhlox Also, that should be Jiro, not Jairo. Have no idea where that autocorrect came from.

@PrairiePhlox The Mystery of DB Cooper on HBO Max was interesting, too. Never Surrender, the Galaxy Quest documentary on Prime was a lot of fun and if you‚Äôve ever watched Apocalypse Now, Hearts of Darkness: A Filmmaker‚Äôs Apocalypse was fascinating and is worth the cost of the rental.

@PrairiePhlox Birth of the Dead, a documentary on Romero and Night of the Living Dead is on Prime and is excellent. Same w/Ray Harryhausen: Special Effects Titan. If you‚Äôre looking for series, any of Tony Bourdain‚Äôs shows. Jairo Dreams of Sushi (Hulu, Amazon, Vudu). This is a Robbery (Netflix)
@DanSlott Also, I always thought Dark Angel was a better concept than it was a show - I could see rebooting that.
